response.answer_text: Short version: No. Details: Common sense is a collection of common ways to react to a situation. It covers everyday life situations but also rare situations. It’s more so about how to navigate a common problem like “Don’t forget to wear your seat belt” or “Use an umbrella to avoid becoming wet.” Philosophy, the love of knowledge, is the study of reality, logic, and our understanding. It covers abstract ideas that can easily go beyond an individual’s life such as “Why does anything exist?” and “What does it mean?” From the use of logic, it also shows common sense can be often wrong. Sometimes, it’s more narrow like “Do we still need an umbrella at a water park?”
